title.narrative: Life-Cycle Analysis Curriculum Development And Training, through Supply Chain Vision, Inc.

description.narrative: This activity will provide for the services of a U.S. contractor to develop a life-cycle cost analysis curriculum, pilot the training in up to four countries, revise the curriculum into a final manual, and transfer the finalized curriculum to a web-based platform that the contractor will host for a period of 12 months. The activity will support ongoing and future procurement assistance programs under USTDA's Global Procurement Initiative: Understanding Best Value (GPI). The objective of the LCCA curriculum and training is to help officials understand how to conduct LCCA in the procurement process in an effort to obtain the best value for public funds. The curriculum will provide GPI partner countries with an expanded knowledge of best practices and methodologies needed to move away from least-cost procurement methods to value-based procurement methods, which may increase opportunities for U.S. companies to bid on and potentially win international tenders.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: USTDA Gas Initiative Event, through APTNEXUS

description.narrative: This Gas Initiative Event is held in collaboration with U.S. gas industry partners as well as senior energy officials and stakeholders representing LNG receiving markets that are eager to develop their gas-related infrastructure. This event would both inform U.S. companies about upcoming opportunities associated with the Gas Initiative in addition to exposing U.S. technology and service companies to LNG project development opportunities in key emerging markets.

title.narrative: GPI: Life-Cycle Cost Analysis Curriculum Platform Maintenance and Supp. Training, through Supply Chain Vision, Inc.

description.narrative: This activity funds a sole-source contract for Supply Chain Vision, Inc. to continue to host and maintain the Life Cycle Cost Analysis (LCCA) web-based course developed under a previous contract. The Contractor will be responsible for hosting and maintaining the online course and applying necessary changes to the curriculum for a period of one year plus four option years, if exercised. The LCCA web-based course is utilized to train procurement practitioners in value-based procurement methods under the Global Procurement Initiative: Understanding Best Value (GPI).

title.narrative: GPI: Life-Cycle Cost Analysis Curriculum Platform Maintenance and Supp. Training, through Supply Chain Vision, Inc.

description.narrative: This activity funds a sole-source contract for Supply Chain Vision, Inc. to continue to host and maintain the Life Cycle Cost Analysis (LCCA) web-based course developed under a previous contract. The Contractor will be responsible for hosting and maintaining the online course and applying necessary changes to the curriculum for a period of one year plus four option years, if exercised. The LCCA web-based course is utilized to train procurement practitioners in value-based procurement methods under the Global Procurement Initiative: Understanding Best Value (GPI). This requests authorization to proceed with the optional task for supplemental live trainings under the Life-Cycle Cost Analysis Curriculum Platform Maintenance and Supplemental Training Contract and provides two 60-minute webinars to two current partner countries under the Global Procurement Initiative: Understanding Best Value (GPI). The requested authorization allows Supply Chain Visions, Inc., the Contractor currently providing services under this Contract, to develop and deliver the two 60-minute webinars to two current GPI partner countries.

description.narrative: This technical advisory services contract provides funding for information and communications technology (ICT) procurement specialists to support ongoing and future procurement assistance programs under USTDA's Global Procurement Initiative: Understanding Best Value (GPI). The ICT procurement specialists provide technical advisory services to USTDA for the development of sector-specific training curricula for foreign procurement officials on how to conduct life-cycle cost analyses (LCCA) and best value determinations in the ICT sector.

description.narrative: The multi-country Advanced Technologies for Methane Abatement Reverse Trade Mission (RTM) Series consists of three separate and distinct RTMs designed to showcase advanced U.S. technologies, services, and best practices for methane abatement in the coal, oil, and gas sectors, in addition to waste-to-energy sector solutions that would reduce methane emissions from agricultural and household waste.

title.narrative: Training Symposium - Transportation Security Administration, through National US Arab Chamber Of Commerce (Inc)

description.narrative: This USTDA-funded reverse trade mission (RTM) will support the travel of Indo-Pacific, Ukrainian, and Brazilian aviation security officials and airport representatives to attend the TSA International Aviation Security Training Symposium in the United States. Subsequently, a related workshop to be held in the Indo-Pacific would serve as a follow-on event to the RTM and provide an opportunity to highlight U.S. leadership on key aviation security issues to Indo-Pacific participants. The RTM and workshop will familiarize delegates with TSA requirements, certification processes, and best practices and introduce delegates to U.S. aviation security technologies and their manufacturers.

sector.narrative: Democracy, Human Rights, and Governance - General

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - GPI: Energy Procurement Specialist, through Green Powered Technology, LLC

description.narrative: This technical advisory services contract provides funding for an energy procurement specialist(s) to support ongoing and prospective procurement assistance programs under USTDA's Global Procurement Initiative: Understanding Best Value (GPI). The energy procurement specialist(s) will provide technical, sector-specific training to foreign procurement officials on the importance of acquisition planning and understanding the whole-life costs of their investments in the energy sector. The objective of the training provided by the specialist(s) is to help officials understand how to conduct life-cycle cost analyses and develop objective evaluation criteria to transparently and fairly assess value in large-scale, traditional, and gas-fired power plant tenders. In essence, the specialist(s) will provide technical training on the sector-specific best practices and methodologies needed to move away from least-cost procurement methods to value-based procurement methods, which may increase opportunities for U.S. companies to bid on and potentially win international energy tenders.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

sector.narrative: Democracy, Human Rights, and Governance - General

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - GPI: Transportation Procurement Specialist, through Jacobsen/Daniels Associates, LLC

description.narrative: This technical advisory services contract provides funding for a transportation procurement specialist(s) to support ongoing and future procurement assistance programs under USTDA's Global Procurement Initiative: Understanding Best Value (GPI). The transportation procurement specialist(s) will provide technical, sector-specific training to foreign procurement officials on the importance of acquisition planning and understanding the whole-life costs of their investments in the transportation sector. The objective of the training provided by the specialist(s) is to help officials understand how to conduct life-cycle cost analyses and develop objective evaluation criteria to transparently and fairly assess value in large-scale transportation infrastructure tenders, with an emphasis on aviation infrastructure. In essence, the specialist(s) will provide technical training on the sector-specific best practices and methodologies needed to move away from least-cost procurement methods to value-based procurement methods, which may increase opportunities for U.S. companies to bid on and potentially win international transportation tenders.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Trade-Related Training Program - GLOBAL CUSTOMS MODERNIZATION INITIATIVE, through Macro International

description.narrative: USTDA funding of $1 million supports a worldwide global customs training initiative, a proactive public-private partnership to address critical customs training requirements in developing and middle income countries. This initiative includes a series of senior-level policy dialogues, global training workshops, and project definition activities to advance customs modernization in areas including chain security, port and cargo security, intellectual property rights enforcement, anti-counterfeiting and anti-piracy measures, customs valuation, rules of origin, and compliance with bilateral and multilateral trade agreements.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Other - Research and Analysis Program, through Ascendant Program Services, LLC

description.narrative: This obligation provided funding to exercise the first option year under USTDA's Research and Analysis Program Services contract. Under this contract, Ascendant Program Services, LLC is providing administrative and substantive research and analytical support services, as well as agency-wide evaluation support services relative to the specific programmatic regions in which USTDA operates.
